intro: Palicourea kalbreyeri, commonly known as Kalbreyer's palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role.
